tos.name: Where No Man Has Gone Before
tos.description: While exploring the edge of the galaxy, the Enterprise encounters an energy barrier that gives two crewmen godlike powers.

tos.name: The Corbomite Maneuver
tos.description: The Enterprise encounters a vast alien ship that sets out to test them.

tos.name: Mudd's Women
tos.description: The Enterprise picks up a intergalactic conman, Harry Mudd, and three incredibly beautiful women who harbor a dark secret.

tos.name: The Enemy Within
tos.description: A transporter malfunction causes Captain Kirk to split into his "good" and "evil" selves, and a landing party will freeze to death if they don't merge the two back together.

tos.name: The Man Trap
tos.description: Kirk and his crew are at deadly risk from an alien creature that feeds on the salt in a human body and can take on any form.

tos.name: The Naked Time
tos.description: A strange alien substance causes the crew to act out their deepest inhibitions, while the ship plummets out of orbit.

tos.name: Charlie X
tos.description: Stardate 1533.6: The Enterprise picks up Charlie Evans, a young man who is the sole survivor of a transport crash. Little do they know he possesses extraordinary mental powers which will come to pose a threat to the ship and its crew.

tos.name: Balance of Terror
tos.description: Kirk pits the Enterprise against an invisible spaceship testing the Federation's defenses.

tos.name: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
tos.description: Nurse Christine Chapel is reunited with her old fiance on Exo III, but the scientist has plans for Captain Kirk and the Federation.

tos.name: Dagger of the Mind
tos.description: Kirk investigates an experimental facility for holding prisoners and finds a sinister scheme.

tos.name: Miri
tos.description: Kirk and a landing party are stranded on a planet due to a disease that causes any adult to die a painful death, and must deal with the local children who have survived.

tos.name: The Conscience of the King
tos.description: Kirk is one of the last survivors who can identify a mass killer, who lurks among a Shakespearean troupe aboard the Enterprise.

tos.name: The Galileo Seven
tos.description: Spock  commands a stranded away team when their shuttlecraft is stranded on a planet with hostile natives.

tos.name: Court Martial
tos.description: Captain Kirk's career is at stake when he is put on trial for the loss of a crewman during an ion storm.

tos.name: The Menagerie (1)
tos.description: Spock kidnaps his former captain, the crippled Christopher Pike, and heads for a quarantined planet, putting his career and Kirk's life on the line.

tos.name: The Menagerie (2)
tos.description: Spock's court-martial continues as he attempts to justify his abduction of Pike, the theft of the Enterprise, and his heading for a planet declared forbidden by Starfleet.

tos.name: Shore Leave
tos.description: The Enterprise crew take shore leave on a peaceful, pastoral planet... where their dreams and fantasies come to life.

tos.name: The Squire of Gothos
tos.description: The Enterprise finds itself at the mercy of a seemingly omnipotent being who fancies himself a 18th century Englishman.

tos.name: Arena
tos.description: When a mysterious alien race destroy an Earth colony, the Enterprise pursues but Kirk and the alien captain are forced to fight each other by powerful aliens.

tos.name: The Alternative Factor
tos.description: Kirk and Spock encounter an alien named Lazarus who claims to be from an anti-matter universe.

tos.name: Tomorrow is Yesterday
tos.description: The Enterprise collides with a black hole and is thrown back to Earth in the 20th century, where they must find a way back and erase any trace of their presence. Matters become complicated when they rescue an Air Force pilot and cannot return him without changing history... but if he disappears that will change history as well.

tos.name: The Return of the Archons
tos.description: The Enterprise encounters a seemingly peaceful civilization run by a "benevolent" being named Landru... who intends for them to join his people.

tos.name: A Taste of Armageddon
tos.description: The Enterprise arrives at a planet to establish diplomatic relations and finds itself in the middle of a "peaceful" war that threatens to destroy the ship.

tos.name: Space Seed
tos.description: The Enterprise picks up a crew of genetic supermen from the 20th century... and their leader, Khan, plans to create a new empire.

tos.name: This Side of Paradise
tos.description: The Enterprise crew is trapped in paradise when they come to rescue colonists who have fallen to pacifying alien spores and become infected themselves.

tos.name: The Devil in the Dark
tos.description: Kirk investigates a series of grisly murders on a mining planet that are the work of a seemingly hostile alien creature.

tos.name: Errand of Mercy
tos.description: The Federation and the Klingon Empire teeter on the brink of war as Kirk investigates Organia, a humble planet inhabited by pacifists that is unwittingly caught in the middle.

tos.name: The City on the Edge of Forever
tos.description: Kirk and Spock must travel into the past in order to correct a change that will alter history.

tos.name: Operation -- Annihilate!
tos.description: Kirk and the Enterprise must combat parasitic aliens.

tos.name: Catspaw
tos.description: When a landing party disappears and one man is beamed up dead, Kirk and Spock investigate and meet a pair of aliens who seem capable of performing magic.

tos.name: Metamorphosis
tos.description: When their shuttle is diverted to a planetoid, Kirk meets one of the pioneers of space flight, Zefram Cochrane.

tos.name: Friday's Child
tos.description: Kirk, Spock, and McCoy land on a primitive planet to negotiate a mining treaty, but soon find themselves involved with intrigue and must flee with a pregnant woman into the surrounding mountains.

tos.name: Who Mourns for Adonais?
tos.description: The Enterprise encounters an alien who claims to be the Greek god Apollo.

tos.name: Amok Time
tos.description: Spock must go to Vulcan in order to perform the Vulcan mating ritual.

tos.name: The Doomsday Machine
tos.description: The Enterprise must stop an ancient doomsday weapon that is capable of destroying entire worlds... and has already totalled one Constellation-class cruiser.

tos.name: Wolf in the Fold
tos.description: A serial killer stalks a planet... and Scotty is the prime suspect.

tos.name: The Changeling
tos.description: The Enterprise encounters an ancient Earth probe bent on the sterilization of all life.

tos.name: The Apple
tos.description: Kirk attempts to assist a primitive people that are ruled over by a computer named Vaal.

tos.name: Mirror, Mirror
tos.description: Kirk and three of his officers are accidentally transported into a parallel "mirror" universe where violence, greed, and evil are commonplace.

tos.name: The Deadly Years
tos.description: A landing party, including the command staff, are infected with a disease that causes rapid aging and senility.

tos.name: I, Mudd
tos.description: The Enterprise is taken over by a group of androids who are working for Kirk's old nemesis, Harry Mudd.

tos.name: The Trouble with Tribbles
tos.description: Kirk must defuse a Klingon scheme to destroy a grain shipment... and cope with a seemingly benign creature known as a tribble, which reproduces at amazing speed.

tos.name: Bread and Circuses
tos.description: The Enterprise investigates the disappearance of a merchant ship crew on a planet ruled by a twentieth-century incarnation of ancient Rome.

tos.name: Journey to Babel
tos.description: Spock meets his estranged father when the Enterprise escorts a group of ambassadors to a conference on the planet Babel.

tos.name: A Private Little War
tos.description: Kirk becomes involved in an arms race when the Klingons equip a native people with superior weaponry.

tos.name: The Gamesters of Triskelion
tos.description: Kirk, Chekov, and Uhura are kidnapped and forced to participate in a series of gladiatorial games.

tos.name: Obsession
tos.description: The Enterprise must deal with a creature from Kirk's past that feeds on human blood.

tos.name: The Immunity Syndrome
tos.description: The Enterprise must destroy an enormous space amoeba before it reproduces and threatens known space.

tos.name: A Piece of the Action
tos.description: The Enterprise travels to a planet suffering from cultural contamination from an earlier expedition - the inhabitants mimic the culture of 1930's gangland Chicago.

tos.name: By Any Other Name
tos.description: The Enterprise's command crew must thwart an invasion by aliens from another galaxy who plan to conquer this one.

tos.name: Return to Tomorrow
tos.description: The Enterprise discovers three discorporeal intelligences who seek their help in gaining physical bodies... but one of them has plans of his own.

tos.name: Patterns of Force
tos.description: The Enterprise seek out a historical researcher and discover he has contaminated a culture, rendering it into a near-duplicate of Nazi Germany.

tos.name: The Ultimate Computer
tos.description: The Enterprise is used to test a new super-sophisticated computer, but it soon develops a mind of its own.

tos.name: The Omega Glory
tos.description: The Enterprise investigates the disappearance of another starship and discovers a planet where the inhabitants are immortal... and engaged in a strange parallel of Earth's Cold War period.

tos.name: Assignment: Earth
tos.description: The Enterprise is sent on a mission back to Earth in the year 1968, where the crew encounters the mysterious Gary Seven, who claims to have been sent by advanced beings to save the planet.

tos.name: Spectre of the Gun
tos.description: When coming to an exaphobic isolationist planet, Captain Kirk and his landing party are punished for trepassing.  They are sentenced to death in a surreal recreation of the Gunfight at the OK Corral with the landing on the losing side.

tos.name: Elaan of Troyius
tos.description: The Enterprise must escort an alien princess to her marriage to seal an interplanetary alliance... but she becomes attracted to Kirk.

tos.name: The Paradise Syndrome
tos.description: Spock and the Enterprise crew race to destroy an asteroid threatening a primitive world where an amnesiac Kirk is proclaimed a god by its indigenous people.

tos.name: The Enterprise Incident
tos.description: An unusually tense and irritable Kirk orders his ship into the Romulan Neutral Zone, where it is promptly surrounded. Beamed to a Romulan ship, Kirk lies about the intrusion, then attacks Spock, who responds with a Vulcan death grip.  While the female Romulan commander courts Spock, a secret mission unfolds.

tos.name: And the Children Shall Lead
tos.description: The Enterprise travels to a planet where the members of a scientific team appear to have killed themselves. Their orphaned children are brought back to the ship, where they begin exhibiting odd behavior.

tos.name: Spock's Brain
tos.description: Kirk leads the Enterprise in pursuit of a mysterious alien woman after she beams aboard the bridge and steals Spock's brain.

tos.name: Is There in Truth No Beauty?
tos.description: The Enterprise hosts an alien ambassador whose outward appearance induces madness in humanoids. When Spock is driven mad after an unfortunate oversight, only the ambassador's jealous telepathic companion can save his mind.

tos.name: The Empath
tos.description: On a planet doomed to destruction, Kirk, Spock & McCoy become involved with two aliens who use them as laboratory animals in a bizarre series of tests on an alien empath who may be the savior of her planet.

tos.name: The Tholian Web
tos.description: Captain Kirk finds himself trapped between dimensions on a disintegrating starship. The Enterprise crew works against time to rescue him as the Tholians weave a destructive energy web around their ship.

tos.name: For the World is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
tos.description: The Enterprise must deflect an asteroid on a collision course with an inhabited planet... but discover the asteroid is a spaceship with a population unaware of the outside world.

tos.name: Day of the Dove
tos.description: When the Enterprise brings aboard Klingon prisoners, an alien entity pits both sides against each other in an ever-escalating struggle.

tos.name: Plato's Stepchildren
tos.description: Kirk and his crew find themselves at the mercy of powerful individuals who possess mind-over-matter powers... and plan to use the Enterprise crew for their twisted entertainment.

tos.name: Wink of an Eye
tos.description: Invisible to humans due to their time-accelerated state, a group of aliens invade the Enterprise and attempt to abduct members of the crew to serve as breeding stock for their dying planet.

tos.name: That Which Survives
tos.description: Kirk, McCoy, and Sulu are stranded on a barren planet where a mysterious woman attempts to kill them one at a time, while the Enterprise must travel halfway across the galaxy to rescue them.

tos.name: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
tos.description: The Enterprise finds itself host to two alien beings from the same planet, who share an intense and self-destructive hatred of each other.

tos.name: Whom Gods Destroy
tos.description: Kirk and Spock investigate an insane asylum where a former Starfleet captain is being held, only to discover that he has freed the inmates and is running the place.

tos.name: The Mark of Gideon
tos.description: Kirk beams down on a diplomatic mission... and finds himself in an Enterprise where all the crew have vanished and only a mysterious woman resides.

tos.name: The Lights of Zetar
tos.description: The Enterprise must deal with discorporeal cloud-like corporeal aliens who have already destroyed the inhabitants of a library planet and plan to eliminate the Enterprise crew if they cannot acquire a human host.

tos.name: The Cloud Minders
tos.description: Kirk must resolve a mining dispute on a the cloud city of Stratos to acquire the resources to cure a space plague.

tos.name: The Way to Eden
tos.description: The Enterprise picks up a group of space "hippies" looking for Eden.

tos.name: Requiem for Methuselah
tos.description: While seeking a cure for a fever ravaging the Enterprise, Kirk and Spock encounter Flint, a hermit-like Earthman, and his beautiful young ward.

tos.name: The Savage Curtain
tos.description: Kirk and Spock meet Abraham Lincoln and Surak of Vulcan and must do battle with some of histories most terrible villians.

tos.name: All Our Yesterdays
tos.description: Kirk, Spock, and McCoy become trapped in the past of another world.

tos.name: Turnabout Intruder
tos.description: The Enterprise is in danger when Janice Lester, one of Kirk's former lovers, steals his body.

tng.name: Encounter at Farpoint
tng.description: Stardate: 41153.7 The new captain of the recently built U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Captain Jean Luc Picard, takes the crew on their first mission: to discover the secret of Farpoint Station. During their journey, they encounter an omnipotent being known as Q, who accuses humanity of barbarism, and places them on trial. Jean-Luc must prove otherwise, or the human race will be annihilated.

tng.name: The Naked Now
tng.description: Stardate: 41209.2 The crew of the Enterprise are infected with a virus they contracted while examining the mysterious deaths of the entire crew onboard the Starship Tsilkovsky.

tng.name: Code of Honor
tng.description: Stardate: 41235.25Tasha Yar must fight for her life, and a vaccine, to save a race of people when she is kidnapped and forced to battle with her abductor's wife.

tng.name: The Last Outpost
tng.description: Stardate: 41386.4 A powerful entity disables the Enterprise and a Ferengi ship. Their only means of escape is if they can correctly answer the riddles he asks.

tng.name: Where No One Has Gone Before
tng.description: Stardate: 41263.1 The Enterprise is flung across space into a distant galaxy billions of light years away when a propulsion engineer, and his mysterious companion, attempt to re-design the ship's engine systems.

tng.name: Lonely Among Us
tng.description: Stardate: 41249.3 Picard's mind is taken over by an energy field that the Enterprise passes through.

tng.name: Justice
tng.description: Stardate: 41255.6 Picard is forced to choose between friendship and the Prime Directive when Wesley Crusher is sentenced to death for accidentally breaking the law on Rubicon III.

tng.name: The Battle
tng.description: Stardate: 41723.9 The Ferengi hand over an old ship which Picard once captained: the U.S.S. Stargazer. However, a mind altering device that has been planted on board alters Picard's mind to make him think that he is reliving a past battle, and the target is the Enterprise.

tng.name: Hide and Q
tng.description: Stardate: 41590.5 Q places the senior crew of the Enterprise in a war game that pits them against a boar-faced, Napoleonic enemy.

tng.name: Haven
tng.description: Stardate: 41294.6 Lwaxana pays a surprise visit to the Enterprise and announces the pre-arranged marriage of Deanna to the son of her late husband's best friend.

tng.name: The Big Goodbye
tng.description: Stardate: 41997.7 Picard, Dr. Crusher and Data are placed in great danger when the holodeck malfunctions while they are running a Dixon Hill program, which pits them against 1940's mobsters.

tng.name: Datalore
tng.description: Stardate: 41242.4 The crew of the Enterprise find android parts that are identical to Data's while they are exploring his homeworld. When assembled, an 'evil' twin of Data is created and named 'Lore'.

tng.name: Angel One
tng.description: Stardate: 41636.9 The Enterprise discovers the male crew of a crashed Federation freighter are hiding as fugitives on the planet Angel One, which is dominated and ruled by women.
Stardate: 41365.9 While undergoing repairs, the Bynar Engineers steal the Enterprise to save their planet from destruction.

tng.name: Too Short a Season
tng.description: Stardate: 41309.5 The aging and terminally ill Starfleet Admiral Mark Jameson, who is negotiating the release of hostages, suddenly begins growing younger through an unexplained phenomenon.

tng.name: When the Bough Breaks
tng.description: Stardate: 41509.1 The children of the Enterprise, including Wesley Crusher, are abducted by a race of sterile people who are unable to have children of their own.

tng.name: Home Soil
tng.description: Stardate: 41463.9 The members of an away team investigating the death of an engineer encounter vengeful microscopic life forms.

tng.name: Coming of Age
tng.description: Stardate: 41416.2 While Wesley takes the entrance exam to Starfleet Academy, the Enterprise is investigated by the Inspector General's office and Picard's competency is questioned.

tng.name: Heart of Glory
tng.description: Stardate: 41503.7 Two Klingons, rescued by the Enterprise, try to take over the ship.

tng.name: The Arsenal of Freedom
tng.description: Stardate: 41798.2 The crew encounters bizarre phenomena while searching for the missing U.S.S. Drake.

tng.name: Symbiosis
tng.description: Stardate: UnknownPicard attempts to break an ancient co-dependency between two species on one planet without violating the Prime Directive.

tng.name: Skin of Evil
tng.description: Stardate: 41601.3 When Troi's shuttle crashes on an alien planet, a new being is discovered: an entity that thrives on the suffering of others.

tng.name: We'll Always Have Paris
tng.description: Stardate: 41697.9 Picard meets an old flame, whose husband has created a haywire dimensional experiment.

tng.name: Conspiracy
tng.description: Stardate: 41775.5 The strange behavior of high-ranking officers leads Picard to uncover a twisted alien conspiracy within Starfleet.

tng.name: The Neutral Zone
tng.description: Stardate: 41986.0 A derelict satellite is found with cryonically frozen humans aboard as the USS Enterprise is sent to investigate the destruction of outposts near Romulan space.

tng.name: The Child
tng.description: Stardate: 42073.1 Troi undergoes a mysterious pregnancy when the Enterprise tries to escape from a system that has recently fallen victim to a deadly plague.

tng.name: Where Silence Has Lease
tng.description: Stardate: 42193.6 A mysterious life form known as the 'Nagilum' threatens the life of the crew in his attempt to understand humanity.

tng.name: Elementary, Dear Data
tng.description: Stardate: 42286.3 Data and Geordi become involved with a holodeck program about Sherlock Holmes and his investigations, when they create Sherlock's arch nemesis, Moriarty; however, modifications to the Moriarty character include the capability of out-smarting Data, which leads to some unexpected consequences.

tng.name: The Outrageous Okona
tng.description: Stardate: 42402.7 The Enterprise is placed in a compromising situation when the captain of a disabled starship places the crew in the middle of a love triangle.

tng.name: Loud as a Whisper
tng.description: Stardate: 42477.2 A deaf-mute mediator meets with disaster while being escorted by the Enterprise.

tng.name: The Schizoid Man
tng.description: Stardate: 42437.5 Data is possessed by the consciousness of a brilliant scientist. However, it has a disturbing impact on Data's personality.

tng.name: Unnatural Selection
tng.description: Stardate: 42494.8 A mysterious hyper-ageing sickness kills the crew of a Federation cargo ship, and Dr. Pulaski must race against time to find a cure.

tng.name: A Matter of Honor
tng.description: Commander Riker participates in an officer's exchange program which lands him an assignment on a Klingon Bird-of-Prey. Meanwhile, a Benzite ensign has trouble assimilating to the routines of the Enterprise.

tng.name: The Measure of a Man
tng.description: Stardate: 42523.7 When Data's rights as a sentient individual are placed under trial, Starfleet forces Riker into a position where he must prove that Data is only an Android.

tng.name: The Dauphin
tng.description: Stardate: 42568.8 Wesley falls in love with a passenger the Enterprise is escorting, who has the secret ability to shape-shift.

tng.name: Contagion
tng.description: Stardate: 42609.1 A strange power source disables the Enterprise's computer systems, damages Data's programming and leaves the ship and crew vulnerable to a Romulan attack.

tng.name: The Royale
tng.description: Stardate: 42625.4 An away team is trapped in an alien environment based around a novel entitled 'The Hotel Royale.'

tng.name: Time Squared
tng.description: Stardate: 42679.2 Picard encounters his double from six hours in the future, whose Enterprise had been destroyed.

tng.name: The Icarus Factor
tng.description: Stardate: 42686.4 Riker is promoted to Captain of another Federation ship. Worf must confront his past and his Klingon heritage.

tng.name: Pen Pals
tng.description: Stardate: 42695.3 Wesley must investigate the causes of strange tectonic activity on the planet where Data's pen pal lives.

tng.name: Q Who?
tng.description: Stardate: 42761.3 Q hurls the Enterprise into the Delta Quadrant and introduces the Federation to a powerful new enemy that may destroy the Alpha Quadrant: The Borg.

tng.name: Samaritan Snare
tng.description: Stardate: 42779.1 A race known as the Pakleds kidnap Geordi La Forge. Picard must face surgery when he is left in a near-dead state.

tng.name: Up the Long Ladder
tng.description: Stardate: 42823.2 Picard must convince two dying civilizations that they must co-exist on the same planet to survive, however, they have other plans to ensure their survival: in the form of clones of the Enterprise crew.

tng.name: Manhunt
tng.description: Stardate: 42859.2 While being escorted to a Federation conference by the Enterprise, Lwaxana hunts for a man to satisfy her needs when her sex-drive is quadrupled during a natural mid-life cycle.

tng.name: The Emissary
tng.description: Stardate: 42901.3 Worf is re-united with his former lover, K'Ehleyr, while the Enterprise is ordered to intercept a Klingon ship whose crew has been in stasis for a century.

tng.name: Peak Performance
tng.description: Stardate: 42923.4 Trouble begins when a Ferengi warship stumbles over a war simulation between Riker and Picard, each on different ships, and begins attacking them.

tng.name: Shades of Gray
tng.description: Stardate: 42976.1 Riker is infected with an alien organism that takes over his mind. Dr. Pulaski must force Riker's mind back to a state where it can access primitive survival skills.

tng.name: Evolution
tng.description: Stardate: 43125.8 A system-wide computer malfunction places the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise in grave danger while they are escorting a scientist to a star in the process of exploding.

tng.name: The Ensigns of Command
tng.description: Stardate: 43133.3 A human colony is forced to evacuate a planet when the original inhabitants return and threaten the colonists with annihilation if they do not leave within four days.

tng.name: The Survivors
tng.description: Stardate: 43152.4 The Enterprise discovers a planet that has had all life eradicated, except for two mysterious residents and their home, which has been left in perfect condition.

tng.name: Who Watches the Watchers
tng.description: Stardate: 43173.5 An away team inadvertently breaks the Prime Directive and reveal themselves to a primitive culture on Mintaka III, causing the inhabitants believe that Captain Picard is a God.

tng.name: The Bonding
tng.description: Worf and Wesley must help a 12 year old boy cope with the death of his mother; an archaeologist killed during an away mission to a deserted planet.

tng.name: Booby Trap
tng.description: Stardate: 43205.6 While investigating an ancient ship left adrift in space, the Enterprise accidentally trips the ancient booby trap that disabled the old vessel over 1000 years ago.

tng.name: The Enemy
tng.description: Stardate:43349.2 A blind Geordie is trapped on a hazardous planet with a paranoid and severely injured Romulan. In orbit, a Romulan Warbird is preventing the Enterprise from attempting a rescue mission.

tng.name: The Price
tng.description: Stardate: 43385.6 The Enterprise hosts the negotiations for the rights to a newly discovered, stable wormhole to the Delta Quadrant. One of the negotiators, Devinoni Ral, becomes attracted to Deanna Troi, but he holds a dubious secret.

tng.name: The Vengeance Factor
tng.description: Stardate: 43421.9 The Enterprise crew tries to mend the relationship between a race known as the Acamarians and a faction known as the Gatherers.

tng.name: The Defector
tng.description: Stardate: 43462.5 A defecting Romulan warns the Federation about an impending attack by the Romulans, who are secretly establishing bases within the Neutral Zone.

tng.name: The Hunted
tng.description: Stardate: 43489.2 A potentially new member of the Federation enlists the help of the Enterprise to track down a wanted criminal who has a reputation for his excessive violence. However, the fugitive's actions may not be of his own will.

tng.name: The High Ground
tng.description: Stardate: 43510.7 Dr. Crusher is abducted by a group of terrorists while delivering crucial medical supplies to a planet ravaged by civil war.

tng.name: Déjà Q
tng.description: Stardate: 43539.1 A Calamarian starts attacking the Enterprise while seeking revenge on a powerless Q.

tng.name: A Matter of Perspective
tng.description: Stardate: 43610.4 Riker is accused of murder when a scientist is killed in an explosion. Picard must recreate the recent events in the holodeck to prove his commander's innocence.

tng.name: Yesterday's Enterprise
tng.description: Stardate: 43625.2 A rift in the space/time continuum brings the U.S.S. Enterprise - C forward into the 24th Century, and alters the timeline. In this future, the Federation is at war with the Klingons, Tasha Yar is on the bridge, Worf did not join the Federation, and only Guinan's unique perception of reality may restore the timeline.

tng.name: The Offspring
tng.description: Stardate: 43657.0 Data becomes a father when he creates a Soong-type android in the form of a daughter named Lal. Issues are complicated when Lal starts showing signs of a more evolved consciousness, including the ability to feel emotions, which attracts the attention of Starfleet scientists who want to take her away from Data and examine her advanced systems.

tng.name: Sins of the Father
tng.description: Stardate: 43685.2 Worf is reunited with his long-lost brother when their father is charged with treason for helping the Romulans. Together they make an appeal to the Klingon High Council to challenge the charges, and have them revoked.

tng.name: Allegiance
tng.description: Stardate: 43714.1 Picard is secretly abducted and switched with an alien double. The crews' suspicions are raised when he starts exhibiting unusual behaviour, and is relieved of command.

tng.name: Captain's Holiday
tng.description: Stardate: 43745.2 While on vacation on Risa, Captain Picard encounters two Vorgons from the 27th Century who claim they are searching for a powerful weapon hidden somewhere on the planet.

tng.name: Tin Man
tng.description: Stardate: 43779.3 The Enterprise encounters a 'living' ship in the Neutral Zone, and risks breaking the Romulan Federation alliance in order to bring it into contact with a Betazoid emissary.

tng.name: Hollow Pursuits
tng.description: Stardate: 43807.4 A nervous and insecure officer, Lt. Reginald Barclay, places the Enterprise in great danger when he neglects his duties in Engineering, and instead spends his time acting out his fantasies on the holodeck.

tng.name: The Most Toys
tng.description: Stardate: 43872.2 The crew are shattered by the apparent death of Data in a shuttle explosion, and are prevented from carrying out a detailed investigation when Starfleet gives them orders for a new mission elsewhere. However, the crew don't realize that he was actually abducted and placed on display as part of a collection of rare and valuable items held by a disreputable character.

tng.name: Sarek
tng.description: Stardate: 43917.4 Spock's Vulcan father, Sarek, boards the Enterprise to negotiate political relations with the Legaran. However, Sarek has contracted Bendii syndrome, which causes a Vulcan to gradually lose control, and become overpowered with emotions.

tng.name: Ménage à Troi
tng.description: Riker and Deanna, both on shoreleave, are unexpectedly joined by Deanna's mother, Lwaxana, on Betazed. Shortly, all three are kidnapped by the Ferengi who want to study Lwaxana's telepathic abilities.

tng.name: Transfigurations
tng.description: Stardate: 43957.2 Dr. Crusher becomes attracted to an injured alien with mysterious powers, who is being tracked down by his government like a wanted criminal.

tng.name: The Best of Both Worlds (1)
tng.description: Stardate: 43989.1 An Starfleet expert on the Borg, Lt. Cmdr. Shelby, is assigned to the Enterprise to investigate the disappearance of a Federation colony. Picard is abducted by the Borg and assimilated into the Collective, which forces Riker to attempt a rescue mission.

tng.name: The Best of Both Worlds (2)
tng.description: Riker must pull out all the stops in order to save Earth from a Borg invasion being lead by none other than Locutus - otherwise known as Captain Jean-Luc Picard.

tng.name: Family
tng.description: Picard meets with his older brother in France, and contemplates resigning his Starfleet commission after his ordeal with the Borg. Worf's adoptive parents spend time with their son on the Enterprise, and succeed in embarrassing him in front of his crewmates.

tng.name: Brothers
tng.description: While escorting a seriously ill boy to the closest Federation Starbase for treatment, Data mysteriously takes control of the Enterprise and takes it to a distant planet. He learns that his creator has summoned him for an important meeting that could change his life. However, Dr. Soong unknowingly summoned Data's twin brother Lore, into the bargain.

tng.name: Suddenly Human
tng.description: A custody battle between Picard and a child's adoptive father arises when a boy showing evidence of abuse is discovered.

tng.name: Remember Me
tng.description: Dr. Crusher begins to question her sanity when members of the crew start disappearing one by one, and all evidence of their existence is erased.

tng.name: Legacy
tng.description: The Enterprise is caught in the middle of a civil war when they encounter Tasha Yar's long-lost younger sister, Ishara.

tng.name: Reunion
tng.description: Picard is asked to choose between two candidates to succeed the current Chancellor of the Klingon High Council as the new ruler of the Empire. Worf is disturbed by unexpected news when he is paid a visit by his former lover.

tng.name: Future Imperfect
tng.description: Riker awakens one morning to discover he is suddenly 16 years in the future as the captain of the Enterprise, and negotiating a peace treaty with the Romulans with no recollection of how he arrived at that point in time, or of any recent events.

tng.name: Final Mission
tng.description: Wesley must keep Captain Picard alive on the eve of his entrance exam to Starfleet Academy when their shuttle crashes on a barren moon.

tng.name: The Loss
tng.description: Troi loses her empathic abilities when the Enterprise is caught in the gravitational pull of a black hole.

tng.name: Data's Day
tng.description: A Vulcan Ambassador being escorted by the Enterprise starts exhibiting suspicious behavior. Miles O'Brien marries his fiancée, Keiko Ishikawa in Ten-Forward.

tng.name: The Wounded
tng.description: When the Cardassians start re-arming themselves, a Federation Captain takes it upon himself to remove a potential threat before it escalated. Now, Picard must fight for the Cardassians and stop the renegade from slaughtering innocents.

tng.name: Devil's Due
tng.description: The crew of the Enterprise must defend the planet Ventax from a mythological Devil who re-appears when a 1000 year long era of peace comes to an end.

tng.name: Clues
tng.description: Picard orders a secret investigation when the crew suspects Data of lying about the discovery of a wormhole.

tng.name: First Contact
tng.description: Riker is abducted by a xenophobic race of aliens during a first contact mission. They believe the Enterprise is a scout for an invasion.

tng.name: Galaxy's Child
tng.description: Geordi must work with the real Leah Brahms when she arrives on the Enterprise when a space-borne alien life form thinks the ship is its mother. Tensions rise when she learns that Geordi created a holographic version of her several months before in order to save the ship from danger.

tng.name: Night Terrors
tng.description: Troi faces a recurring nightmare when the Enterprise is caught in a rift in space. Soon, the crew begins to slip into insanity through dream deprivation.

tng.name: Identity Crisis
tng.description: Geordi and a former crew mate begin evolving into bizarre creatures when they return to a planet both of them were on during an Away Mission five years earlier.

tng.name: The Nth Degree
tng.description: An alien probe transforms Barclay from a shy, awkward character into an arrogant super-genius who is able to interface with the Enterprise's computer through the holodeck.

tng.name: Qpid
tng.description: Q places Vash and the senior Enterprise crew in a recreation of Robin Hood and his merry men.

tng.name: The Drumhead
tng.description: Picard is accused of treason when an explosion aboard the Enterprise is investigated by a ruthless and paranoid Starfleet Admiral.

tng.name: Half a Life
tng.description: Lwaxana Troi falls in love with a man who must return home to commit suicide, as is customary for their race when they reach a certain age.

tng.name: The Host
tng.description: Dr. Crusher falls in love with a Trill Ambassador, until she discovers the Trill's symbiotic relationship.

tng.name: The Mind's Eye
tng.description: While en route to Risa for shore leave, Geordi is abducted by the Romulans and brainwashed into becoming an assassin.

tng.name: In Theory
tng.description: Data experiences the complexities of love when a fellow crewmate becomes attracted to him.

tng.name: Redemption (1)
tng.description: Worf must choose between his people and the Federation when a civil war threatens to destroy the Klingon Empire.

tng.name: Redemption (2)
tng.description: Stardate: 45020.4 - Picard suspects a Romulan influence in the recent Klingon civil war, and must force the Federation to intervene before the Empire collapses.

tng.name: Darmok
tng.description: Stardate: 45047.2 - Picard must find a way to communicate with the newly discovered Tamarians, who speak entirely in metaphors, when a Tamarian Captain is brutally killed.

tng.name: Ensign Ro
tng.description: Stardate: 45076.3 - Picard exposes a planned genocidal attack on the Bajorans with the help of a new officer, Ensign Ro Laren.

tng.name: Silicon Avatar
tng.description: Stardate: 45122.3 - Picard attempts communications with the Crystalline Entity - a life form responsible for hundreds of deaths throughout the Alpha Quadrant. However, a scientist on board the Enterprise has plans of revenge over the death of her only son at the hands of the Entity.

tng.name: Disaster
tng.description: Stardate: 45156.1 - A natural disaster leaves Troi in command of the Enterprise, Picard stuck in a turbo lift with three small children and Keiko O'Brien stuck in Ten-Forward giving birth with an anxious Worf.

tng.name: The Game
tng.description: Stardate: 45208.2 - An addictive game is distributed among the crew of the Enterprise, however, it appears that this game interferes with a person's logic and reason, which leaves the crew open to manipulation. Only a young Ensign and a vacationing Wesley Crusher are able to think for themselves, and must find a way to reverse the damage before the ship falls into the wrong hands.

tng.name: Unification (1)
tng.description: Ambassador Spock has disappeared and intelligence finds him on Romulus.  Captain Picard is sent to Romulus to find Spock.  Meanwhile, Riker and the rest of the crew investigate the fragments of a Vulcan ship discovered in the wreck of a Ferengi vessel.

tng.name: Unification (2)
tng.description: Stardate: 45245.8 - Picard and Data find Spock and discover the reason behind the secret meetings. However, a darker scheme planned by the Romulans is also uncovered in the process.

tng.name: A Matter of Time
tng.description: Stardate: 45349.1 - While on a mission to help a planet recently struck by an asteroid, the Enterprise is paid a visit by a man who claims to be from the future.

tng.name: New Ground
tng.description: Stardate: 45376.3 - Worf's son, Alexander, unexpectedly arrives on the Enterprise to stay with his father. However, Alexander wants to stay permanently.

tng.name: Hero Worship
tng.description: Stardate: 45397.3 - The Enterprise investigates the cause of an explosion which destroyed a small ship and its entire crew, except for a small boy.

tng.name: Violations
tng.description: Stardate: 45419.3 - While escorting a group of telepaths, crew members on board the Enterprise suddenly start to slip into comas.

tng.name: The Masterpiece Society
tng.description: Stardate: 45470.1 - A natural disaster in the core of a system's sun threatens to destroy a colony of genetically engineered people on an otherwise desolate planet. However, the crew's intervention may cause more harm than good.

tng.name: Conundrum
tng.description: Stardate: 45494.2 - The Enterprise crew unknowingly receives a new first officer who claims that the Federation is at war with another species.

tng.name: Power Play
tng.description: Stardate: 45571.2 - While en route to the source of a subspace distress signal coming from a desolate moon, Data, Troi and O'Brien take over the bridge and force the ship to change course.

tng.name: Ethics
tng.description: Stardate: 45587.3 - When Worf is paralysed in an accident he must undergo drastic back surgery. However, this experimental technique may cost him his life.

tng.name: The Outcast
tng.description: Stardate: 45614.6 - While investigating the disappearance of a J'naii shuttlecraft, the crew finds reason to believe the missing ship is stranded in an abnormal pocket called "null space." Riker and Soren, a member of the J'naii race, begin preparing to rescue the craft, and the two strike up a friendship. Their relationship develops quickly as the pair question each other about mating habits, since the J'naii are androgynous and do not identify themselves as either male or female. Despite this difference, sparks begin to fly between them.

tng.name: Cause and Effect
tng.description: Stardate: 45652.1 - While exploring the Typhon Expanse, the Enterprise is caught in a time warp in which they are repeatedly destroyed while colliding with another starship.

tng.name: The First Duty
tng.description: Stardate: 45703.9 - Wesley is involved in a cover-up at Starfleet Academy when a cadet is killed and five shuttles are destroyed during a forbidden maneuver performed by Starfleet Academy's best cadets.

tng.name: Cost of Living
tng.description: Stardate: 45733.63 - Deanna's mother pays a surprise visit to the Enterprise with even more surprising news: she plans to marry a man she has never met. After destroying an asteroid, the ship becomes infected with parasites that eat away at the ship's hull.

tng.name: The Perfect Mate
tng.description: Stardate: 45761.3 - The Ferengi try to abduct an empathic Metamorph who could bring peace between two warring worlds.

tng.name: Imaginary Friend
tng.description: Stardate: 45832.1 - While exploring a strange form of energy in a region of space, a little girl's imaginary friend becomes real and places the Enterprise in great danger.

tng.name: I, Borg
tng.description: Stardate: 45832.1 - An injured Borg is discovered and brought back to the Enterprise where he is 'repaired' by Dr. Crusher and befriended by Geordi, who names him 'Hugh.' Soon, Hugh starts showing signs of individuality while Picard must choose between destroying him or returning him to the collective.

tng.name: The Next Phase
tng.description: Stardate: 45092.4 - While the Enterprise helps a Romulan science vessel, an accident occurs which forces Geordi LaForge and Ro Laren slightly out of 'phase', causing them to become undetectable to everyone but each other. As a result, the crew thinks they are dead and make arrangements for their funerals, even though they are closer than the crew realise.

tng.name: The Inner Light
tng.description: Picard is struck by an energy beam from an alien probe, which renders him unconscious and places him in the life of a citizen on the planet Kataan, with his memory of the Enterprise intact.  Although he searches for a way to return, he finally decides to live his life with his Kataan wife, have children & grandchildren, learning to play a flute and completely immersing in the Kataan culture...

tng.name: Time's Arrow (1)
tng.description: Stardate: 45959.1 - Data's head is uncovered in an archaeological dig on Earth, where evidence is also found that aliens may have been on Earth as early as the 19th Century. Using modified technology, an away team follows Data into the late 1890s to investigate.

tng.name: Time's Arrow (2)
tng.description: The away team's investigations are hampered by a nosy Samuel Clemens. Picard discovers that he originally met Guinan in the 1890s on Earth.

tng.name: Realm of Fear
tng.description: Lt. Barclay's fear of using transporters is eerily justified when he sees bizarre aliens within the transporter beam.

tng.name: Man of the People
tng.description: Deanna becomes attracted to an alien ambassador. Shortly thereafter, she starts ageing rapidly and starts becoming violent.

tng.name: Relics
tng.description: Montgomery 'Scotty' Scott is discovered suspended in a transporter beam 75 years after he disappeared. After the Enterprise crew re-materialise him, he has a hard time adjusting to the new society.

tng.name: Schisms
tng.description: Members of the crew are secretly abducted from the Enterprise to be used in bizarre experiments where they are dismembered and re-assembled without anyone's knowledge - including their own. The only signs that anything is wrong is a strange form of tiredness and no recollection of having slept well the night before.

tng.name: True Q
tng.description: A young intern visiting the Enterprise captures the interest of Q when she starts displaying Q-like powers.

tng.name: Rascals
tng.description: A transporter accident transforms Picard, Ro Laren, Guinan and Keiko O'Brien into small children who appear to be about 12 years old. Matters are complicated when the Ferengi seize the Enterprise.

tng.name: A Fistful of Datas
tng.description: Worf and his son, Alexander, become trapped in the holodeck when their Wild West program malfunctions. However, they must find a way to defeat the holographic bandits who have Data's appearance and abilities.

tng.name: The Quality of Life
tng.description: Data discovers that the maintance robots built by Dr. Farallon may have become sentient.

tng.name: Chain of Command (1)
tng.description: Picard resigns as Captain of the Enterprise to lead a top-secret espionage mission into Cardassia with Worf and Dr. Crusher.

tng.name: Chain of Command (2)
tng.description: Picard is captured and tortured by the Cardassians, while Riker tries to prevent a Federation attack on Cardassia.

tng.name: Ship in a Bottle
tng.description: While performing holodeck maintenance, Barclay accesses the stored hologram of Professor Moriarty, who wreaks havoc on board the Enterprise.

tng.name: Aquiel
tng.description: Geordie falls in love with a lieutenant who is the prime suspect in a murder case.

tng.name: Face of the Enemy
tng.description: Troi is abducted and surgically altered by the Romulans as part of a ploy to smuggle intelligence operatives into the Federation.

tng.name: Tapestry
tng.description: A mortally wounded Picard is forced into re-living a time of his life when he was back in Starfleet Academy, with the intervention of Q.

tng.name: Birthright (1)
tng.description: While visiting Deep Space Nine, Worf learns that his father is still alive and being held captive in a secret Romulan prison camp.

tng.name: Birthright (2)
tng.description: Worf is captured by the Romulans where he learns why the other captives did not attempt an escape years before.

tng.name: Starship Mine
tng.description: The crew evacuates the Enterprise when the ship needs to be cleaned of particles that have built up over the ship's hull. However, Picard accidentally stumbles over a terrorist group who plan on destroying the ship. He only has a short time to stop their attempts before the ship is swept by a beam of radiation to remove the particles that is lethal to all forms of life.

tng.name: Lessons
tng.description: Picard must choose between love and command when he must make a decision that could place the woman he loves in a potentially deadly and high-risk mission.

tng.name: The Chase
tng.description: Picard's old archaeology professor is found murdered, the crew try to complete his research. Soon, the crew must compete with Romulans and Klingons and Cardassians to uncover the truth behind his discoveries.

tng.name: Frame of Mind
tng.description: Riker questions his sanity when his reality seems to shift between an alien psychiatric hospital and a play he is performing with other members of the crew.

tng.name: Suspicions
tng.description: Dr. Crusher puts her career on the line when she tries to clear the name of a murdered scientist whose invention could allow starships to pass through a sun's corona.

tng.name: Rightful Heir
tng.description: While on a quest to summon a vision of Kahless, Worf questions his faith when the real Kahless rises from the dead to lead the Empire.

tng.name: Second Chances
tng.description: Riker discovers that eight years ago, an exact clone of him was created when he beamed through a planet's surface while returning to his starship. This clone, named Thomas Riker, has secretly remained on the planet for the past eight years, and still has romantic feelings for Troi.

tng.name: Timescape
tng.description: Stardate: 46944.2 - Picard, Geordi, Troi and Data return from a Federation conference to find the Enterprise frozen in time and under attack from a frozen Romulan Warbird.

tng.name: Descent (1)
tng.description: Stardate: 46982.1 - The Borg return to threaten the Federation under the new leadership of Lore. Data experiences a disturbing facet of human emotions - he feels pleasure after killing a Borg drone.

tng.name: Descent (2)
tng.description: Data abducts Picard, Troi and Geordi and holds them prisoners of the Borg, while he derives pleasure from being evil. Dr. Crusher is left in command of the Enterprise as it comes under attack from a Borg vessel.

tng.name: Liaisons
tng.description: During an exchange program, Picard's shuttle crashes on an unknown planet where he is rescued by the sole survivor of another crash.

tng.name: Interface
tng.description: Geordi defies direct orders from Captain Picard in an attempt to rescue his mother who had recently been reported as missing.

tng.name: Gambit (1)
tng.description: An away team investigates the apparent death of Jean-Luc Picard who was supposedly killed in a bar fight. When Riker is abducted by a band of criminals who loot archaeological digs, he is shocked to find Picard alive and well, and undercover as a renegade archaeologist.

tng.name: Gambit (2)
tng.description: Picard and Riker covertly work together in an attempt to find out why the criminals are looting archaeological digs.

tng.name: Phantasms
tng.description: Data's new dream subroutine causes him to experience nightmares which provide a unique insight into strange events that are occurring on board the Enterprise.

tng.name: Dark Page
tng.description: Lwaxana Troi collapses with a repressed memory related illness. Her only chance for survival is if Deanna can probe her subconscious and find out what is killing her. However, the secret Lwaxana holds is deeper than Deanna imagined.

tng.name: Attached
tng.description: While on a a diplomatic mission, Dr. Crusher and Picard are captured and imprisoned. As a result, they are linked together via a telepathic device.

tng.name: Force of Nature
tng.description: The Enterprise is drawn to a region of space where many starships have been mysteriously disabled. They soon learn that a brother and sister team has been working together to bring attention to the fact that frequent high-warp travel is damaging the very fabric of space/time.

tng.name: Inheritance
tng.description: Data is disturbed by the claims of a woman who says she is Noonien Soong's ex-wife.

tng.name: Parallels
tng.description: Worf returns from a Klingon competition to find that he is shifting through different realities.

tng.name: The Pegasus
tng.description: Riker is placed on a covert mission to find the missing starship he was once a member aboard, but the mission holds a secret that could destroy the peace treaty between the Federation and the Romulans.

tng.name: Homeward
tng.description: Worf's adoptive brother violates the Prime Directive to save an alien society whose planet is dying.

tng.name: Sub Rosa
tng.description: Dr. Crusher attends her grandmother's funeral, to find that she had been in romantic encounters with a mysterious man who had been haunting the Howard family women for generations.

tng.name: Lower Decks
tng.description: Four young ensigns compete for a promotion that only one of them will receive. However, they are soon placed on a top secret mission that places some of their lives in danger.

tng.name: Thine Own Self
tng.description: Data find himself mysteriously stranded on a planet with no recollection of who he is or how he arrived there. Soon he is accused of spreading a plague among the inhabitants. Troi takes the bridge officer's test in an attempt to gain the rank of Commander.

tng.name: Masks
tng.description: The Enterprise is slowly transformed into an ancient alien temple when Data discovers an alien archive full of information about an ancient culture. Shortly after opening the archive, Data becomes possessed with several different personalities.

tng.name: Eye of the Beholder
tng.description: While investigating the mysterious suicide of a crew member, Troi and Worf begin to show romantic feeling towards one another.

tng.name: Genesis
tng.description: Upon returning from an away mission, Picard and Data find the ship drifting in space, and the crew de-evolving into their animal ancestors.

tng.name: Journey's End
tng.description: Under the terms of the new Federation/Cardassian alliance, Picard is ordered to evacuate a colony of native Americans, but protests from Wesley hamper the process. Wesley's destiny is finally revealed to him when the Traveler returns.

tng.name: Firstborn
tng.description: A disinterested Alexander must face his first Right of Ascension passage, but a mysterious warrior by the name of K'Mtar brings with him a disturbing request.

tng.name: Bloodlines
tng.description: Picard tries to save his newly-discovered son from the retaliation of a vengeful Ferengi whose only son was killed by Picard during the Battle of Maxia many years before.

tng.name: Emergence
tng.description: The Enterprise's computer systems starts having repeated malfunctions, leading the crew to believe that it may be evolving into a new life form.

tng.name: Preemptive Strike
tng.description: Fresh from Starfleet's Advanced Tactical Training course, Ro Laren is assigned to infiltrate the Maquis. However, over time she begins to sympathize with them, which forces her to choose between her loyalty to the Federation, and her new friends in the Maquis.

tng.name: All Good Things...
tng.description: Stardate: 47988.0 - Shortly after Picard is diagnosed with a long-term, potentially debilitating brain disorder, he starts experiencing bizarre shifts into three main time periods: 25 years into the future, a few days before the Enterprise-D is sent on its mission to Farpoint station, and the present...

ds9.name: Emissary
ds9.description: Commander Benjamin Sisko and a new crew of Starfleet and Bajoran officers take command of an abandoned Cardassian space station and make an incredible discovery that will change the galaxy.

ds9.name: Past Prologue
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - Major Kira's loyalties are questioned when she helps an old friend, now a suspected terrorist trying to destroy the Bajoran Wormhole.

ds9.name: A Man Alone
ds9.description: Stardate: 46421.5 - Mob hysteria grips the station when Odo is suspected of committing a murder after a Bajoran's body is discovered.

ds9.name: Babel
ds9.description: Stardate: 46423.7 - Miles O'Brien unknowingly triggers a Cardassian booby trap that releases a potentially fatal virus throughout the station.

ds9.name: Captive Pursuit
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - O'Brien befriends an alien who belongs to a race of beings that are bred to be hunted by another species.

ds9.name: Q-Less
ds9.description: Stardate: 46531.2 - Q arrives on DS9 fresh from exploring the Gamma Quadrant with Vash. Soon afterwards, power fluctuations grip the station.

ds9.name: Dax
ds9.description: Stardate: 46910.1 - Jadzia Dax is accused of a murder committed by her symbiont in another lifetime.

ds9.name: The Passenger
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - Bashir is posessed by an alien criminal in an attempt to hijack a Gamma quadrant freighter.

ds9.name: Move Along Home
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - Quark is forced to play a game by the Wadi, a newly encountered species, and the lives of the crew depend on the outcome.

ds9.name: The Nagus
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - Quark is appointed as ruler of the Ferengi Empire when the Grand Nagus enters into early retirement; however, all is not as it may seem.

ds9.name: Vortex
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - Odo arrests a criminal from the Gamma Quadrant who offers to take him to his people on the other side of the wormhole.

ds9.name: Battle Lines
ds9.description: Stardate: Unknown - Sisko, Bashir, Kira and Kai Opaka become stranded on a planet ravaged by war where the inhabitants can't die and are unable to leave.

ds9.name: The Storyteller
ds9.description: Stardate: 46729.1 - O'Brien is appointed as the spiritual leader of a Bajoran village when he and Bashir are unable to save the dying predecessor.

ds9.name: Progress
ds9.description: Stardate: 46844.3 - While overseeing an evacuation mission, Kira must try to persuade a stubborn old farmer to leave his home.

ds9.name: If Wishes Were Horses
ds9.description: The inhabitants of Deep Space Nine are mystified when their fantasies turn into reality, however, these occurrences foreshadow a disaster.

ds9.name: The Forsaken
ds9.description: A visiting Lwaxana Troi becomes enamoured with Odo after he retrieves a stolen item of hers from a thief.

ds9.name: Dramatis Personae
ds9.description: Sisko and Kira are possessed by alien forces and fight for control of the station.

ds9.name: Duet
ds9.description: A visiting Cardassian may in fact be a notorious war criminal, and Kira is determined to bring him down

ds9.name: In the Hands of the Prophets
ds9.description: Friction escalates when Vedek Winn arrives on Deep Space Nine and discovers schoolteacher Keiko O'Brien is teaching about aliens in the wormhole.

ds9.name: The Homecoming
ds9.description: Kira and O'Brien try to rescue a famed Bajoran resistance fighter from a Cardassian slave-labour colony in an attempt to bring peace to the warring Bajoran factions.

ds9.name: The Circle
ds9.description: After she is relieved of her post aboard, Deep Space Nine, Kira tries to expose the leaders of the terrorist group known as 'The Circle.'

ds9.name: The Siege
ds9.description: Sisko is forced to evacuate the station when the war escalates and turns in favor of the terrorists.

ds9.name: Invasive Procedures
ds9.description: An unjoined trill kidnaps Jadzia and removes the Dax symbiont to implant into himself.

ds9.name: Cardassians
ds9.description: A custody battle emerges over an orphaned Cardassian boy who was raised by Bajorans.

ds9.name: Melora
ds9.description: Bashir falls in love with a wheelchair-bound woman, who is unable to walk in Deep Space Nine's level of gravity.

ds9.name: Rules of Acquisition
ds9.description: A female Ferengi disguises herself as a male in order to help Quark with business deals in the Gamma Quadrant.

ds9.name: Necessary Evil
ds9.description: Quark is injured in an attack which Odo suspects is related to a murder committed five years before, in which Kira was the prime suspect.

ds9.name: Second Sight
ds9.description: For the first time since the death of his wife, Sisko falls in love. However, his new interest seems to suffer from a bizarre form of split personality.

ds9.name: Sanctuary
ds9.description: A group of refugees from the Gamma Quadrant claims that Bajor is their long-lost homeland.

ds9.name: Rivals
ds9.description: A con artist opens a bar with a gambling machine that can alter the laws of probability.

ds9.name: The Alternate
ds9.description: Dr. Mora Pol, who first studied Odo as an infant, announces that he may have found Odo's homeworld in the Gamma Quadrant.

ds9.name: Armageddon Game
ds9.description: Bashir and O'Brien come under attack from the people they are trying to help on a warring planet.

ds9.name: Whispers
ds9.description: O'Brien returns from an away mission to discover that he has been locked out of every security system on the station, and that everyone has turned against him, including his wife.

ds9.name: Paradise
ds9.description: Sisko and O'Brien are stranded on a planet with a human colony that has forbidden all forms of technology.

ds9.name: Shadowplay
ds9.description: Odo and Dax discover a planet where the inhabitants are disappearing.

ds9.name: Playing God
ds9.description: While hosting a Trill initiate, Jadzia discovers a new universe growing from protoplasm in the science labs.

ds9.name: Profit and Loss
ds9.description: Quark puts everything at stake to win back his long love Natima Lang, a Cardassian woman suspected of terrorism on Cardassia.

ds9.name: Blood Oath
ds9.description: Jadzia Dax honors an oath made by Curzon Dax to a group of Klingons, and goes with them on a crusade against their sworn enemy.

ds9.name: The Maquis (1)
ds9.description: Federation colonists reject a treaty with Cardassia and take matters into their own hands, forming a terrorist group called 'The Maquis'.

ds9.name: The Maquis (2)
ds9.description: Sisko's friend, Commander Cal Hudson, resigns from Starfleet to join the Maquis in their fight against the Cardassians.

ds9.name: The Wire
ds9.description: In order to save Garak's life, Bashir must unravel some of the secrets in the Cardassian's past.

ds9.name: Crossover
ds9.description: An accident, which occurs while traveling through the wormhole, leaves Kira and Bashir stranded in an alternate universe where humans are slaves.

ds9.name: The Collaborator
ds9.description: Kira discovers that the man she loves, Vedek Bareil, may have been responsible for the death of 43 Bajoran freedom fighters.

ds9.name: Tribunal
ds9.description: O'Brien is found guilty and later tried at a tribunal held on Cardassia Prime.

ds9.name: The Jem'Hadar
ds9.description: Sisko, Jake, Nog, and Quark go camping on a Gamma Quadrant world but are captured by mysterious soldiers called the Jem'Hadar and meet a force to rival the Federation.

ds9.name: The Search (1)
ds9.description: Sisko is assigned the mission of taking the Defiant into the Gamma Quadrant to make peaceful contact with the founders of the Dominion.

ds9.name: The Search (2)
ds9.description: Odo begins to connect with his fellow Changelings as Sisko attempts to negotiate peace with the Dominion.

ds9.name: The House of Quark
ds9.description: Quark lies about killing a Klingon and is then forced to marry the widow.

ds9.name: Equilibrium
ds9.description: A secret from Dax's past could mean the end of the current host's life.

ds9.name: Second Skin
ds9.description: Kira is surprised to find records indicating that she was incarcerated at Elemspur, a Cardassian prison, 10 years ago.

ds9.name: The Abandoned
ds9.description: A Jem'Hadar infant is found in salvaged spaceship wreckage and Odo strives to teach the rapidly maturing soldier to think for himself.

ds9.name: Civil Defense
ds9.description: Deep Space Nine is progressively locked down after O'Brien, Jake and Sisko accidentally activate an old automated Cardassian security program.

ds9.name: Meridian
ds9.description: Jadzia falls in love with a scientist on a planet whose inhabitants shift between this universe and a plane of pure energy every sixty years.

ds9.name: Defiant
ds9.description: When Commander William T. Riker from the Enterprise arrives on Deep Space 9, he takes a liking to Kira, who gives him a tour of the Defiant. But Riker is revealed to be not who he claims to be when he attacks Kira and steals the ship.

ds9.name: Fascination
ds9.description: Lwaxana Troi pursues Odo during the Bajoran Gratitude Festival as members of the crew suddenly become infatuated with one another.

ds9.name: Past Tense (1)
ds9.description: A transporter accident sends Sisko, Bashir and Dax three centuries into Earth's dark past.

ds9.name: Past Tense (2)
ds9.description: Sisko assumes the role of a pivotal historic figure in order to restore the timeline.

ds9.name: Life Support
ds9.description: Bashir's ethics are put to the test as he keeps Vedek Bareil alive long enough to help Kai Winn complete negotiations for a peace treaty with Cardassia.

ds9.name: Heart of Stone
ds9.description: Searching for a Maquis raider on an unstable moon, Kira is trapped in an expanding crystal formation that threatens to engulf her if Odo cannot set her free.

ds9.name: Destiny
ds9.description: Despite a Bajoran prophecy of destruction, Sisko assists in a joint scientific venture with the Cardassians to open communications through the wormhole.

ds9.name: Prophet Motive
ds9.description: In a shock revelation to Quark and Rom, the Grand Nagus reveals he has re-written the Ferengi Rules of Acquisition; a move which threatens to cripple the Ferengi Empire.

ds9.name: Visionary
ds9.description: Exposure to radiation causes O'Brien to jump hours into the future for brief periods, as Deep Space Nine hosts Romulan and Klingon delegations.

ds9.name: Distant Voices
ds9.description: After an alien assault leaves Bashir unconscious, he is trapped inside his mind.

ds9.name: Through the Looking Glass
ds9.description: Sisko is abducted by the Miles O'Brien from the mirror universe, and is forced to assume the identity of their Sisko in order to rebel against the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance.

ds9.name: Improbable Cause
ds9.description: Garak's tailor shop is bombed, forcing Odo to investigate who is trying to kill the Cardassian exile.

ds9.name: The Die is Cast
ds9.description: Garak must decide whether or not to kill Odo to please his mentor on the eve of a joint Romulan-Cardassian attack on the Dominion.

ds9.name: Explorers
ds9.description: Sisko and Jake build a solar sailing ship in an attempt to recreate a journey taken by the ancient Bajorans.

ds9.name: Family Business
ds9.description: Quark returns to his home planet to confront his mother after hearing from the Ferengi Commerce Authority that she broke the law by earning profit.

ds9.name: Shakaar
ds9.description: Kai Winn needs Kira to convince her former resistance leader, now a farmer on Bajor, to return soil reclamators needed elsewhere.

ds9.name: Facets
ds9.description: Jadzia Dax deals with feelings of inferiority as she encounters past hosts in a Trill ceremony.

ds9.name: The Adversary
ds9.description: A Changeling sabotages the USS Defiant as it attempts to start a war in the Alpha Quadrant.

ds9.name: The Way of the Warrior
ds9.description: Stardate: 49011.4. When a Klingon fleet under General Martok arrives at the station ostensibly to protect the Alpha Quadrant from the Dominion, Sisko recruits Worf to discover the Klingons' true intentions.

ds9.name: The Visitor
ds9.description: An elderly Jake Sisko relates the story of how he lost his father to a temporal displacement accident.

ds9.name: Hippocratic Oath
ds9.description: Bashir assists a rogue group of Jem'Hadar attempting to overcome their addiction to Ketracel White.

ds9.name: Indiscretion
ds9.description: Kira and Dukat embark on a mission to find lost Bajoran prisoners. On the mission, Dukat reveals that he too has someone he is concerned about on the ship, a Bajoran woman with whom he had an affair.

ds9.name: Rejoined
ds9.description: Dax is reunited with one of her former hosts' mates, and the two struggle with their feelings for one another.

ds9.name: Starship Down
ds9.description: The USS Defiant becomes trapped in a planet's volatile atmosphere after battling with the Jem'Hadar.

ds9.name: Little Green Men
ds9.description: Quark, Rom and Nog are accidentally thrust back in time to Roswell, New Mexico, Earth in 1947.

ds9.name: The Sword of Kahless
ds9.description: Worf, Dax and a revered Klingon warrior, Kor, search for the Sword of Kahless to unite the Klingon Empire.

ds9.name: Our Man Bashir
ds9.description: Bashir  plays a 1960s secret agent in a holosuite, but when it is used in an emergency to store the transporter patterns of some of the crew, he must make life or death decisions.

ds9.name: Homefront
ds9.description: Sisko and Odo are brought to Earth when it's suspected Changelings are infiltrating Starfleet.

ds9.name: Paradise Lost
ds9.description: As Sisko and Odo prepare for a Dominion invasion they discover a plot to place the Federation under military control.

ds9.name: Crossfire
ds9.description: Odo's hidden feelings for Kira surface when the visiting Bajoran First Minister begins to court her.

ds9.name: Return to Grace
ds9.description: Dukat seeks Kira's help in regaining his rank in the Cardassian Empire.

ds9.name: Sons of Mogh
ds9.description: Cast out of Klingon society because of Worf's dishonor, his outcast brother asks Worf to kill him.

ds9.name: Bar Association
ds9.description: Rom creates a union for Quark's employees and goes on strike.

ds9.name: Accession
ds9.description: A famous Bajoran poet who disappeared over 200 years ago appears from the wormhole and convinces Sisko that he is the true Emissary.

ds9.name: Rules of Engagement
ds9.description: Worf accidentally destroys a civilian ship during battle and faces a hearing to determine whether he should be extradited to the Klingon Empire.

ds9.name: Hard Time
ds9.description: O'Brien is incarcerated for 20 years on an alien world on charges of espionage. However the experience was implanted into his mind, and O'Brien struggles to re-adjust to station life.

ds9.name: Shattered Mirror
ds9.description: Sisko attempts to rescue Jake after he is lured into a war-torn mirror universe by his mother's living counterpart.

ds9.name: The Muse
ds9.description: While Odo assists a pregnant Lwaxana Troi, Jake falls under the spell of a mysterious woman.

ds9.name: For the Cause
ds9.description: Sisko learns that his girlfriend Kasidy may be a Maquis smuggler.

ds9.name: To the Death
ds9.description: Sisko and the Defiant crew join forces with the Jem'Hadar to stop a group of Jem'Hadar renegades from gaining power.

ds9.name: The Quickening
ds9.description: Bashir tries to free the population of a Gamma Quadrant world of an engineered disease left by the Dominion 200 years ago.

ds9.name: Body Parts
ds9.description: Quark is diagnosed with a terminal disease and sells his body parts on the Ferengi Futures Exchange.

ds9.name: Broken Link
ds9.description: Odo is forced to return to his people, the Changelings, to face judgment for killing one of his own.

ds9.name: Apocalypse Rising
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownGowron is suspected of being replaced by a changeling. Sisko, Odo and O'Brien go undercover as Klingons, only to discover things may not be what they seem.

ds9.name: The Ship
ds9.description: Stardate:50049.3 While searching for minerals on a planet, Sisko, Dax, O'Brien, Worf, and Muniz discover the wreckage of a crashed Jem'Hadar ship. However, they are not the only ones interested, because the Dominion is anxious to retrieve the vessel.

ds9.name: Looking for par'Mach in All the Wrong Places
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownWorf falls in love with Quark's ex-wife, Grilka. However, Quark is also still interested.

ds9.name: ...Nor the Battle to the Strong
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownJake Sisko and Julian Bashir are caught in the middle of a battle between a Federation colony and a Klingon army.

ds9.name: The Assignment
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownA Pah'wraith (evil entities who are enemies of the Bajoran Prophets) possesses and impersonates Keiko, but reveals her identity to Miles, threatening to kill her if he doesn't carry out her mysterious instructions.

ds9.name: Trials and Tribble-ations
ds9.description: Stardate:4523.7 While returning to Deep Space Nine with the Bajoran Orb of Time, the crew are thrown back to the 23rd Century. They must infiltrate the original Starship Enterprise in order to stop an undercover Klingon from poisoning a shipment of grain being carried.

ds9.name: Let He Who is Without Sin...
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownWorf, Dax, Leeta, Quark and Bashir pay a visit to Risa. Things go bad when a band of rebels gains control of the planet's weather regulator to scare the visitors in an attempt to show them how unprepared the Federation is for the Dominion invasion.

ds9.name: Things Past
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownSisko, Odo, Dax and Garak are shifted into the past, when DS9 was known as Terok Nor. To each other, they appear normal, but to others they appear as Bajoran slaves. Soon they are accused of planting a bomb, and are sentenced to death.

ds9.name: The Ascent
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownOdo and Quark are stranded when they crash on a planet with no communications or replicators. Their only hope to be found is if they can climb to the top of a high mountain. Back on the station, Jake and Nog are moving in together. However, it doesn't go as smoothly as they thought.

ds9.name: Rapture
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownSisko discovers the legendary Bajoran city of B'hala. He also receives visions of Bajor's future, one of which warns him not to let Bajor join the Federation.

ds9.name: The Darkness and the Light
ds9.description: Stardate: 50416.2 One by one, members of the Shakaar resistance cell are murdered, and Kira becomes increasingly worried that she will be next.

ds9.name: The Begotten
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownKira goes into labor with Keiko's child. Odo buys an infant changeling from Quark that was found drifting in space. Tensions rise when the scientist that first studied Odo, Dr. Mora Pol, arrives to give Odo a helping hand.

ds9.name: For the Uniform
ds9.description: Stardate: 50485.2 Sisko encounters Eddington, his former security chief turned Maquis traitor, and he is more desperate to capture him than ever.

ds9.name: In Purgatory's Shadow
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownAfter a coded Cardassian message from the Gamma Quadrant is detected, Garak and Worf attempt a rescue. However, they are captured by the Jem'Hadar and imprisoned in the same cell as Enabran Tain, General Martok, and the real Julian Bashir, who had been secretly replaced several weeks prior without any notice. The Jem'hadar fleet invades the Alpha Quadrant when an attempt to seal the wormhole is sabotaged by the changeling-Bashir.

ds9.name: By Inferno's Light
ds9.description: Stardate: 50564.2 When the Dominion fleet comes through the wormhole, it soon becomes clear that Cardassia has allied itself with the Dominion and that war is not far off. As the forces of the Alpha Quadrant assemble, the changeling posing as Dr. Bashir is wrecking havoc on Deep Space Nine.

ds9.name: Doctor Bashir, I Presume?
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownBashir is chosen as the model for Starfleet's next Emergency Medical Holographic Doctor. During the process it is revealed that Julian was illegally genetically enhanced as a child, rendering him a genius. However, his father must now face a jail term or his son Julian will be court-martialled from Starfleet.

ds9.name: A Simple Investigation
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownA woman has her memories erased and stored on a data crystal to infiltrate the Orion Syndicate. Odo falls in love with her, but must save her life by finding her data crystal.

ds9.name: Business as Usual
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownQuark enters into the booming business of arms dealing with his cousin. However, his new enterprise may cost him his life.

ds9.name: Ties of Blood and Water
ds9.description: Stardate: 50712.5 A Cardassian dissident opposed to the Cardassian/Dominion alliance asks Kira to pose as his daughter so that he may reveal his secrets to use against his enemies as is customary in his culture. Kira must overcome painful memories of her own father's death before she can face him and gain the information.

ds9.name: Ferengi Love Songs
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownQuark discovers that his mother, Ishka, is having a love affair with the Grand Nagus Zek. Back on the station, Leeta and Rom decide to get married. However, problems soon arise.

ds9.name: Soldiers of the Empire
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownWorf and Dax join a Klingon ship captained by General Martok on his first mission since being freed from the Dominion prison. However, the crew is in such a low state of morale that when they encounter a Jem'Hadar warship, they enter a battle for their lives.

ds9.name: Children of Time
ds9.description: Stardate: 50814.2 The Defiant enters a barrier surrounding a planet in the Gamma Quadrant, only to find its inhabitants are the crew's descendants from 200 years in the past.

ds9.name: Blaze of Glory
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownSisko receives a message from one of the few surviving Maquis members saying that they will launch undetectable missiles at the Cardassians, which will provoke an all out war. Sisko enlists the help of Eddington to aid him in deactivating them, however, all is not as Sisko had been informed.

ds9.name: Empok Nor
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownIn order to repair the damaged Deep Space Nine, O'Brien assembles a team to salvage parts from the abandoned Empok Nor. However, their presence sets off an old booby trap that will put all of their lives in danger.

ds9.name: In the Cards
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownJake and Nog attempt to obtain an ancient baseball card to help lift Ben out of his depression. However, in order to get it from its new owner, they must steal equipment from the station, but this brings them under interrogation from the Dominion.

ds9.name: Call to Arms
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownLeeta and Rom get married. Sisko decides to mine the wormhole, which will likely start the war. When their plan is detected, Sisko is forced to evacuate the station and endorse the non-aggression pact between Bajor and the Dominion. While patrolling the border, General Martok detects the first wave of Dominion ships headed for Deep Space Nine. All remaining Starfleet personnel are ordered to leave the station. Kira, Odo, Quark, Rom, Morn and Jake stay behind on the station and disable it as it is handed over to the Dominion.

ds9.name: A Time to Stand
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownSeveral months after Deep Space Nine was handed over to the Dominion, the Federation is losing the war. Being relieved of command of the Defiant, Sisko is placed in command of a salvaged Jem'Hadar warship they discovered several months earlier, and must destroy the main Ketracel White production facility in the Alpha Quadrant. The mission is a success but it leaves the ship without warp engines and stranded 17 years from the nearest Federation Starbase.

ds9.name: Rocks and Shoals
ds9.description: Stardate: 51107.2 The damaged Jem'Hadar ship captained by Sisko crashes on a planet. Dax is seriously injured, but kept alive by Dr. Bashir. A group of Jem'Hadar who also crashed on the ship finds them, and takes them to their injured Vorta leader, who has a proposition for Sisko he may not be able to refuse.

ds9.name: Sons and Daughters
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownWorf must help his son, Alexander, to learn the ways of a Klingon warrior, while on a ship patrolling for Dominion vessels.

ds9.name: Behind the Lines
ds9.description: Stardate: 51149.5 Sisko is promoted, and Dax is placed in command of the Defiant. She must disable a Dominion sensor array that has been monitoring all traffic within five sectors. Meanwhile, on Deep Space Nine, now named Terok Nor, Kira must find a way of preventing the minefield from being destroyed. Odo's loyalties are questioned when he physically joins with the Founder Leader.

ds9.name: Favor the Bold
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownOdo struggles with his choices between his friends and the link. Sisko faces a suicide mission in order to reclaim Deep Space Nine. Rom is ordered to be executed. Ziyal is assaulted by Damar - Kira sees this altercation and nearly kills Damar over it.

ds9.name: Sacrifice of Angels
ds9.description: Stardate: UnknownCaptain Sisko and his taskforce engage the Dominion as Starfleet pushes to reclaim DS9. Meanwhile on the station, the Dominion tries to complete its plan for removing the mines from the wormhole, and meet internal resistance.
